questions.question: Find HGL. Water is flowing through a pipe of diameter 26m and length 53m, when one end of the pipe is connected to a tank and other end is open to the atmosphere. The height of water level in the tank is 4m above the centre of the pipe. Consider all minor losses. Take f = 0.006, take rho = 1000kg/m<sup>3</sup>.

Find HGL. Water is flowing through a pipe of diameter 28m and length 43m, when one end of the pipe is connected to a tank and other end is open to the atmosphere. The height of water level in the tank is 5m above the centre of the pipe. Consider all minor losses. Take f = 0.006 and take rho = 1000kg/m<sup>3</sup>.
